description: Fully declarative validation rules - no hardcoded Python logic required

R1.1.1.name: entry_id_required
R1.1.1.description: Entry ID is required and must be non-empty
R1.1.1.error_message: Entry ID is required and must be non-empty

R1.1.2.name: lexical_unit_required
R1.1.2.description: Lexical unit is required and must contain at least one language entry
R1.1.2.error_message: Lexical unit is required and must contain at least one language entry

R1.1.3.name: sense_required_non_variant
R1.1.3.description: At least one sense is required per entry (except for variant entries with variant-type trait)
R1.1.3.error_message: At least one sense is required per entry

R1.2.2.name: lexical_unit_content_validation
R1.2.2.description: Lexical unit content must be non-empty strings
R1.2.2.error_message: Lexical unit content cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R1.2.3.name: language_code_validation
R1.2.3.description: Lexical unit must contain at least one language
R1.2.3.error_message: Lexical unit must contain at least one language

R2.1.1.name: sense_id_required
R2.1.1.description: Sense ID is required and must be non-empty
R2.1.1.error_message: Sense ID is required and must be non-empty

R2.1.2.name: sense_content_or_variant
R2.1.2.description: Sense must have definition, gloss, or variant reference
R2.1.2.error_message: Sense must have definition, gloss, or be a variant reference

R2.2.1.name: definition_content_validation
R2.2.1.description: Sense definitions must have at least one non-empty language value
R2.2.1.error_message: Sense definition cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R2.2.2.name: gloss_content_validation
R2.2.2.description: Sense glosses must have at least one non-empty language value
R2.2.2.error_message: Sense gloss cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R2.2.3.name: example_text_validation
R2.2.3.description: Example texts must be non-empty when example is present
R2.2.3.error_message: Example text cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R3.1.1.name: unique_note_types
R3.1.1.description: Note types must be unique within entry

R3.2.1.name: multilingual_note_structure
R3.2.1.description: Multilingual notes must be objects with at least one language
R3.2.1.error_message: Multilingual note must contain at least one language

R3.1.2.name: note_content_validation
R3.1.2.description: Note content must be non-empty strings when present

R4.1.1.name: pronunciation_language_codes
R4.1.1.description: Pronunciation language codes must be valid

R4.1.2.name: ipa_character_validation
R4.1.2.description: IPA characters must be from approved character set

R4.2.1.name: no_double_stress_markers
R4.2.1.description: Double stress markers (ˈˈ or ˌˌ) are not allowed

R4.2.2.name: no_double_length_markers
R4.2.2.description: Double length markers (ːː) are not allowed

R5.1.1.name: synonym_antonym_exclusion
R5.1.1.description: Entries cannot be both synonym and antonym
R5.1.1.error_message: Entry cannot have both synonym and antonym relations to the same entry

R5.2.1.name: subsense_depth
R5.2.1.description: Subsense nesting must not exceed 3 levels
R5.2.1.error_message: Subsense nesting exceeds maximum depth of 3

R6.1.1.name: unique_languages_in_multitext
R6.1.1.description: Language codes must be unique in multilingual content
R6.1.1.error_message: Duplicate language code found in multilingual content

R6.1.2.name: conflicting_sense_pos_requires_manual_entry_pos
R6.1.2.description: If senses have conflicting POS values, entry POS must be set manually
R6.1.2.error_message: Entry must have grammatical_info when senses have conflicting POS

R7.1.1.name: date_fields_format
R7.1.1.description: Date fields must be in ISO8601 format
R7.1.1.error_message: Date field must be in ISO8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)

R8.1.1.name: no_circular_component_references
R8.1.1.description: Component relations must not reference the entry itself
R8.1.1.error_message: Component relation cannot reference the entry itself (circular reference)

R8.1.2.name: no_circular_sense_references
R8.1.2.description: Sense relations must not reference senses within the same entry
R8.1.2.error_message: Sense relation cannot reference a sense within the same entry (circular reference)

R8.1.3.name: no_circular_entry_references
R8.1.3.description: Entry-level relations must not reference the entry itself
R8.1.3.error_message: Entry relation cannot reference the entry itself (circular reference)

R5.3.1.name: relation_targets_exist
R5.3.1.description: All relation targets must exist in the dictionary
R5.3.1.error_message: Relation target '{value}' does not exist in the dictionary
